Description: Rim sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; part of lotus flower in added white outline with added red centre; exterior: at rim, diagonal stroke band above Z frieze between pairs of dilute lines; below, painted decoration consisting of part of creature (possibly part of a boar's crest or a sphinx's wing) probably to right.
Curator's comments: Lemos interprets the decoration as part of a lion's mane. However, such lines more closely resemble the crest on a boar's back, or part of a sphinx's wing.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 262, no. 535)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0461) (phase 2)
